meanings.sent1: She reassured her friend that everything would be okay.
meanings.sent2: The teacher reassured the students before the exam.
meanings.sent3: His silly dance moves reassured everyone at the party.
meanings.sent4: The warm sunlight reassured the flowers after a storm.

meanings.definition: To give someone confidence or hope
meanings.sent1: He reassured his sister that she could do it.
meanings.sent2: The coach reassured the team before the big game.
meanings.sent3: The funny joke reassured everyone in the room.
meanings.sent4: The lighthouse reassured sailors in the dark night.
meanings.sent5: The kind words reassured the shy student to speak up.

meanings.definition: To make someone feel less worried or fearful
meanings.sent1: The doctor reassured the patient about the upcoming surgery.
meanings.sent2: Her smile reassured him during the scary movie.
meanings.sent3: The playful puppy reassured the child in the new environment.
meanings.sent4: The familiar song reassured her during the long journey.
meanings.sent5: The gentle touch reassured the anxious cat at the vet.
